title: Bicycle playing card fonts
content:
Hello!

Anyone have thoughts about what fonts or likenesses of them are going on in a playing card?  
The ace, bicycle font and the copy at the bottom as well.

Thanks for playing!  
Liz

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061046im_/http:/typophile.com/files/card_3429.jpeg)
author: lizthiem

comments.content:
This font is based on the numbers and letters

[http://www.haroldsfonts.com/cardchars.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061046/http:/www.haroldsfonts.com/cardchars.html "http://www.haroldsfonts.com/cardchars.html")

Here's another thread on the subject

[http://www.typophile.com/node/10679](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061046/http:/www.typophile.com/node/10679 "http://www.typophile.com/node/10679")

Greetings,  
Besides the Numbers series from HFJ, which you might find useful, there's a free font called "Bicycle" which you might find to be of some help, though it's not a match:

[http://www.dafont.com/bicycle.font](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061046/http:/www.dafont.com/bicycle.font "http://www.dafont.com/bicycle.font")

Now that I think of it, there are also a few fonts at Letterhead Fonts that might be of use, especially with some tweaking:

[http://www.letterheadfonts.com/viewallfonts/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215061046/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/viewallfonts/ "http://www.letterheadfonts.com/viewallfonts/")

A font called LHF Bill Blake comes to mind, but you might find better.
